answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I have found some resources which may help answer your question. Although they may not directly address each of your questions, they might provide a good starting point.  
I found some links to other similar discussions about headhunters that may help you make your decision.
One is an online career counselor who has used a headhunter successfully in the past.
http://www.moneycrashers.com/are-job-headhunters-career-counselor-gurus-worth-it/
I have also included a link which includes general information about headhunters and their benefits.
http://www.ehow.com/info_8014470_should-use-headhunter-job.html
For the other side of the story I have included a Business Week article called, “Avoiding Headaches with a Headhunter.”
http://www.businessweek.com/careers/content/sep2004/ca20040927_0019_ca009.htm 
I hope these resources are help.
Ali Iannolo
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

answers.author: Amanda Relyea
answers.text:
Hi Jason, I talked to Greg Bielawski, head of ICMA's Range Rider Program and a retired manager. He said that he has "read cautions and warnings about using such services to find any kind of job because there are many scammers and the fees can be high." Greg thinks you have done the right thing by contacting (and providing a resume) executive search firms that specialize in local government management recruitment and selection. He would caution that if you do decide to contract with a firm, although likely not necessary, that the detailed service(s) to be provided and the fees be clearly defined and in writing. 
Here is a link to an article on executive search firms and employment agencies:  http://jobsearch.about.com/od/searchfirms/a/headhunter.htm

author: Jason Oberle
text:
I am in transition and have been advised by professional friends to consider using professional head hunter services.  Additionally, I have been in contact with many of the Executive Recruitment firms who list jobs here at ICMA and elsewhere seeking local government managers.
Can and will anyone give me some information about the pros and cons of this idea.  For example I can list with a company for about $340 for a lifetime membership.  I think this is pricey, and wonder if additional expenses may be required later, (i.e. portion of salary if they find me a job, various fees).
Thanks,
Jason
title: Head Hunter Services
